Blog.post: urlLink they serve these up as a delicacy in some parts of Japan - adequately cooked and fried of course. They also make sports drinks out of them - VAAM! Posted by Paul

urlLink eeeevil large Hornet thing - they make drinks from these things - called VAAM! In other parts of Japan, these guys are served up in large quantities as a delicacy. Cooked and fried adequately of course. Posted by Paul

I finish rehab around sunset time on Monday evenings, and the sun melts away behind the mountains of Kobe and the local JR freight yard giving all but psychedellic colours urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul

I work in the midst of relative wilderness of Kobe right now, and currently, am doing 'home visits' to some local elementary schools - thoroughly enjoyable. This is the walk (read: hike) to one of them. Houses dotted around lush wilderness with amply babbling brooks (american vocab) dashing and splashing downhill. The local area has also turned up vast quantities of bronze-age articles from many aeons ago... urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul

Its hot and humid, and school doors and windows are usually wiiiide-open, unless they're lucky enough to have air-conditioning (the only ones lucky enough to have this are schools next to railway lines, for obvious noise reasons). With such open access, we get a wide variety of kingdom animalia. Pigeons (rare), lizards, enormous bugs, a fair share of giant hornets, and 'things' like this be-yotch. I just slapped her across the chops with some heavy print so she's about to barf. :) urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink "I scream we scream and I kill for ice-cream." -Shot and Posted by Paul

Both bottles of red wine from ~1989... the lower equates to ~£gbp1000 urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
Osaka - second biggest city in Japan - largest consumer shopping paradise in the world... urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
"I can stick to this diet, I CAN stick to this di.... aaah fuck it." "*uurp* its gotta taste f**king good, right? otherwise you wont wanna eat it." urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul

On a slightly different tangent - bumped into these fellows, some of the biggest damned ants Ive ever seen, and they can run faster than me. Psycho, huh? Probably only takes a couple of them to lift a human up. Anyway, this one (top middle) was checking out his dude friend (below left) who tried bench-pressing a sneaker with a human attached to it. urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
A wonderful proliferation of colours - no two Yukatas were alike! urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul

Some nice women make a turn-out. What made this year spectacular was that thousands turned out in Yukatas and their spirits weren't dampened by the light rain which quickly cleared. urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
Even the little ones get all dressed up! urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
Young ladies dressed up in their Yukatas gaze onward at the evening light of Himeji-Jo urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
Todays mish-mash of evening sun and cloud colour. At vanishing point, the sun can be seen melting away into some high-level cloud patterns further down the globe. urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul

And here they are up close... rather harmless. This can be determined from the fact that they aimlessly crash into anything at breakneck speeds. Aiding them in their quest to acquire negative IQ through continuous brain-damage. Oh, and seeking out chick beetles and getting down... urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul

The big flying beetle bastards are everywhere! And they show no quarter while they hump wildly on my front door, porch, balcony, window.... etc.... almost as horny as me. urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
Sometimes how I feel when Ive been studying for too long... urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink What a happy family! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Brett aptly displays his footy foot -Shot and Posted by Paul

Also at the Suzurandi Bunkasai - Took a quick stab at some Shodo (calligraphy - "the way of writing"), and found that I wasn't so bad at it. Not terribly good, either. But I chose some kanji I knew and spelt out my name as best I could. Well chuffed! urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
Cultural difference. We don't have these scary looking things. I shall feign ignorance and pretend not to know what it is. urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul

This weekends Suzurandai bunkasai - with Ethan James and Motoki. About the most impressive single piece of work I saw was "The Scream" rendered from thousands of folded cranes - the principle behind it not being too dissimilar to the girl who began to fold thousands of paper cranes during her terminal suffering from Cancer because of the A-bombs dropped on Japan. Perhaps just fluke, but a stark image indeed. urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
Got stalked by this bad-ass on my hike up to my apartment. It has the damndest longest mostest long antennae ever. A true swordsman! urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
One of the reasons I love Japan. urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul
Just got this in the mail... hehehehe =) urlLink -Shot and Posted by Paul

(content which could possibly bore the average reader has been [re]moved) I shall leave you with two quotes: "At bottom, every man knows perfectly well that he is a unique being, only once on this earth; and by no extraordinary chance will such a marvelously picturesque piece of diversity in unity as he is, ever be put together a second time." -Friedrich Nietzsche, philosopher (1844-1900) "Friend, don't be a perfectionist. Perfectionism is a curse and a strain. For you tremble lest you miss the bulls-eye. You are perfect if you let be. Friend don't be afraid of mistakes. Mistakes are not sins. Mistakes are ways of doing something different, perhaps creatively new. Friend don't be sorry for your mistakes. Be glad for them. You had the courage to give something of yourself. It takes years to be centered; it takes more years to understand and be NOW." Friedrich Salomon Perles (Fritz) - In and Out the Garbage Pail
mmmm! Lunch! urlLink -Posted by Paul

23 hours remaining.... Prep in full swing. Party vibe building +_+
Mmmmm. Precious Alcohol. urlLink urlLink Rubix cube in 16 seconds . I'm impressed. -Posted by Paul

urlLink Party - all questions I have had emailed to me regarding the party so far were all answered in the email I sent out last month... anyway, the phone has been rining and plenty of folk have been asking if they can bring along a few more people. The more the merrier! Less to go around?? urlLink HERE are the departing subway timetables for those interested. I have also printed copies and put them up at my place. Just got off the phone from Steven, and he informs me that DJ proceedings will be starting later ! In case you didn't bother reading it (as expected), here it is again. Additionally, I would like to tell everyone I operate a no-smoking policy in my premises. And all crash places are full, so if you fall unconscious, I will put you outside ;) ------------------------------------------------- What: ---------- Party Who: ---------- JETs, KATEs, friends of, my friends, invite as you please, but keep it reasonable (whatever that is) When: ---------- B - SATURDAY 12TH of JUNE (next month, weekend after recontracting conference) From around 5PM to around 11PM See you then! Where: ---------- Pablo's Apartment, 721 building. Amity Gakuennishimachi/Gakuentoshi Nishi-Ku Featuring: ---------- -Easter Egg Hunt for those who missed Easter fun! -Twister! -Star Gazing! -Sh*t loads of free alcohol (1stC1stS) -Softdrinks also available for non-alkys and drivers -Drinking Games! -Party Games! -Prizes! -DJs! -Music! -Etc! Preparations: ----------- Can everyone bring a carton of their favorite juice along to help out with the dilution of drink? Hauling the requisite amount up my stairs is a bit bothersome. This variation will allow everyone to make a large proliferation of cocktail types - hooray! Cocktail books? Bring them! Games? Bring them! Hot Ladies? Bring them! Forward this to anyone I may have missed. Reminders: ---------- We dont tolerate: baiting, trolling, fighting, arguing with the host (I'm always right no matter what, if you disagree with anything I say, you are still wrong), and other things that with a bit of common sense are easy to avoid. The blurb: ------------ Yo people, I know you're there, so answer this email. I'm throwing a big punch party at my place now that winter is over - just for the hell of it. What I need to know is numbers and how many heads I'm buying alcohol for. Everyone is invited - JETs, KATEs, CIRs, Japanese friends, teachers etc - but its going to be a first come first serve agenda on the day of the party as you know how difficult it is to fit all of this years Kobe JETs into our pokey apartments. If you would like to attend, please reply to this email. For those of you who attended Caras Christmas bash, you'll know the size of her apartment. My pad is roughly 2-3 times bigger, so there shouldn't be too much squeezing *ahem* - at least up to the first 50 people. Five flights of stairs will certainly sort the wheat from the chaffe. The punch parties before now have basically consisted of an industrial sized container filled with a lethal mixture of alcoholic and non based drinks (this is Japan, itll probably be smaller). Combined with some fun drinking games (prior suggestions welcomed), dares, forfeits and us, this will make for interesting general carnage and debauchery. This will also be good fodder for the chroniclers of the 2003/04 Kobe JET video. Caterers and/or food is welcome, if you really want to bring a bucket of KFC, so be it. Organising the drinking mission will be tough enough, so help here is appreciated. Events such as these ideally go through the night, and when the smoke clears from the battle-field, anyone who brings necessary provisions is welcome to crash. *prior confirmation recommended Japanese version follows (set browser encoding to UTF-8): 寒い冬も終わって暖かくなってきたことですし、時間や日付はまだ決めてませんが今月僕のうちで皆さんご存知のカクテルパーティーをします。特にこれといった理由があるわけではありませんが、楽しそうだし、何よりたくさんの人が来ると、暖房なしで僕の部屋が温まるでしょ？ ということで、事前に何人ぐらい来られるかを知りたいので、参加できるかどうかをこのメールに返信して 教えてください。 JET、KATE、CIR、日本人の友達、先生方、どなたでも歓迎です。でも、監獄みたいに狭い僕の部屋に全員入るのは厳しいでしょうから、どうしても先着順に中に入ってもらうことになると思います。カーラのクリスマスパーティーに参加した方は予測がつくと思いますが、僕の部屋は、だいたいあの２～３倍です。だから、少なくとも最初の５０人までは大丈夫でしょう。 これまでのカクテルパーティーでも、かなり大量の強いカクテルを用意していました。それに、罰ゲームや宴会向けゲーム（何かアイディアがあれば、言ってください）が加わると、本当に恐ろしいぐらい盛り上がること間違いなしだと思います。それに、今ぼくたちが 撮影している2003年度JETのビデオ作りにもいい機会になることでしょう。 食べ物を作ってきたり、持ってきてくれるのも大歓迎です。もしケンタッキーのボックスを持ってきたければ、それでもいいです。 これだけの規模の飲み会になると、「それぞれができることをする」という方式に頼らざるを得ません。すべての飲み物を用意するということはかなり厳しいので、カンパや手伝いは大歓迎です！ みなさん、よろしくお願いします。 こういうイベントはオールナイトが理想的ですから、協力してくださった皆さんでパーティーが終わった後にそのまま休みたい人がいれば、遠慮なく泊まっていってください。事前に言ってくれると嬉しいです。 urlLink -Posted by Paul

Doc says my knee is getting better, and Aki, my Physio dude reckons its on the way up - still painful though. I also invited Aki down to the party, so for any single females desiring that 'nice Japanese guy', here he is. :)

Yeh-heah, baby. This Saturday sees the arrival of wanton carnage and debauchery in the form of a party im throwing. With a good few months worth of planning and, dare I say, careful thought, it should be fun. Many things organised, and a few goodies in there too. Games with prizes *oooooh* and some DJs *aaaah* a live photo show *mmmmmmmmm* and VFX *waaaah-whoooh*. That said, it can all fall apart at the last minute, but theres always the crates of free alcohol to spice things up. urlLink I also hit a few curious variables - some people don't like parties, but I'll just put this down to the fact that they've always been disappointed before now. Liken the disappointment to women getting the kind of 'regular' sex from a your average joe man who busts his balls on a nine to five, comes home rather depleted but nonetheless happy to see his missus. They've just not had the right *party* yet. ;) 5 weeks until a home-visit, some exciting sounds in the DnG foundry, summer-time. Ho-hum, many things to look forward to anyway.

To clear up any confusion on that last post: I had to crash in Kobe at Chito's place after I went to get my camera battery. Unfortunately, I missed my connecting train from Kobe by 2 minutes, because of A) knee injury B) being so ripped ; ) Chito offered me floor-space to crash after getting pounded by the rain and posessing an empty wallet at midnight. Taxis set you back a fair whack of 6000 yen from Sano to Gak. Steeeep! Anyway, being so happy to get my camera battery back, i took lots of pictures in the AM. So no, I didn't have lots of chicks staying over at my place. Booo.

AKs boss frequently taunts her at 10PM saturday evening ('personal time') telling her to come in to work on Sunday morning (during 'personal time'). We have been reciprocating cultural expressions that address this situation - one in Japanese "shikataganai" meaning "it cant be helped", and my reciprocal *ahem* "fuck you". I have also suggested expressions such as "raise". With such hard work, don't you think its a good idea? -Posted by Paul

Russ, the original salty dawg is back in town from the deadly gangstadise (I just invented a word, claim!) LA. On our first night we successfully drank sh*tloads. Motoki got THRASHED. Ethan, on a rare occasion, got waay drunk. Russ loves to see Ethan get drunk and start a fight, thus why Ethan doesnt drink very often. still funny. On our way back, we got a couple of free beers. All in all, an enjoyable and memorable occasion! ; )

My baby coleman chair - the best! I got it for about 800 yen, which is roughly 4 quid or 8 bucks. I can now sit comfortably anywhere, or ideally, my roof, sipping beer, watching stars, sunsets, DVDs, listening to tunes, [insert past-time here]. Edit: Rian decided to one-up me and get a bigger one, that you can even sit a beer can in the custom holder. WAR! urlLink -Posted by Paul
Another sunset boiling up the sky. Fantastic colours all the year round. urlLink -Posted by Paul

Pano shot from my hotel window. Port Island, entirely man-made island using land-reclaimation just off the natural coast of Kobe. It has lots of hotels and apartments on it. Even a school where some lucky JETs get to teach. The whole Island has a strange 'feel' to it if you ever visit it. Almost ghostly. urlLink -Posted by Paul

Steve, fellow room-mate from the conference, underscored the importance of the whole event by checking out a day early. Bless. Well, we did have a few wicked nights out on the town. I ended up staying out until about 4AM, caning some Drum & Bass at SoulBlood, and Steve caning beer at Sally's. The Hotel lobby was often frequented with conference paticipants in most inebriated states as late as 5AM. Points go to the participants who set sparklers off in their rooms and wondered why they couldn't wipe the 'stains' off the carpets in the morning. Still, I guess you'd have to be pretty leathered at breakfast time on checkout day. D'oh! Anyway, a most welcome 3 days off of work.
urlLink The stag do was going down in Liverpool, but the preperation on the train made it enjoyable and memorable. Beer was EVERYWHERE! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink When you get oiled up on the train, you just gotta go! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Manchester is probably the only place in England where it ever gets so busy the trains are literally packed. Tut tut. Snort. Try Japan, you LIGHT WEIGHTS! -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink The time came, and I had to leave my old stomping grounds, so I got on the train and joined a stag do and get well oiled up on my journey over to Manchester. Think-while-you-drink later, and it was getting a wee bit rowdy. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Kim's hair was straight - finally, I love it! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink I met Kim's little brother, Zachariah. Kewl! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Tweed's lashing the cancer nails. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Anyway, we got up to loads of mischief on the way home, and frankly, I don't remember some of it! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Tweed felt compelled to embelish us with some history of the local surroundings. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink We woke Mitch up. He loved it. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink I was compelled to stand on this big wall and do the biz off of it. No prizes for where it was! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Brenda values her "spot" at the bar, so she tells people to go away. Nicely of course. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Khan actually knew a fair bit of Japanese! -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink Me totally unaware being away in Japan for a year, my friends put up some 50000000000000 foot by 500000000000000 foot posters of us clubbing one night. And believe it baby, that's me in the cream shirt, right hand picture. They felt obliged to honour my absence with a hyowge fook off poster of me. Bless. I feel so special! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Met with some mandatory Kee-bab spewage. Yum. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink met Khan, and had a class time in the 'Bull -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink met this class lass who had some novel colours on. And She received a few compliments from me, and I received a few from her. It was all good! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Also met up with Hannah, and we spoke at length about worldly issues, my how she has come along! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Anyway, I got to Mitch's and we jammed. And the music kicked ASS. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Theres also a place called, "Deaf Hill". Weeeeeird. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Azalea terrace North, ubiquitous skag den of Sunderland. Don't ever go there. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink I was walkin to Mitch's for a Jam session, and this dude took a rest in front of me. -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink In one of Tweedy's garden parties, we got totally wrecked and Tweedy's dog didnt take a liking to anyone, I wanted to drop kick the 'orrible little fucker over the fence, but his mother wouldnt have approved. The dog savaged Murphy, top, and he wasnt happy! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Also saw Darren, a phine saxophonist! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink a little cuba rocked the joint! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Also saw Ka-Jonsk! my wicked mate of many years! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Saw Brett, the crazy dude! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink went to see my mates who've formed a new band called "A Little Cuba" and Michguel acquired himself a new lady! Woot! Respec! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink My camera battery just couldnt handle any more so I borrowed Craig's camera and caned loads of designery shots. -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink I got stuck into Brenda's fridge... we had a class time. I got introduced to a nice young lady called "Jenna", or so I thought after I discovered her voracious appetite for... -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink Went up to Newcastle and Sunderland, and Brenda had her birthday BBQ. And she had a surprise... gay-o-gramme. Anyway, it was all well funny, and class, and... hair of the dog. We got wrecked, and passed a few jaftas. AGAIN! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Tweedy was there, and we decided that even the straight-up Vodka route wasn't going to produce pretty results, so opted in for some Long Island action! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Lisa N took advantage of me. Totally. -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink Lisa N walked INTO THESE. Admittedly worse for wear on wine (touché!) , but I laughed heartily, and nurtured her afterward and helped her regain her pride on out march to the next bar. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Kick ass. "Wattie" as they say. We rocked Newcastle. Although most unfortunately I felt highly inadequately dressed for it..... -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Paris was playing bongo's, and he rocked the house.... actually the bar was called "apartment". How AMERICAN! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink also bumped into the boyz, and they were lovin it. 'ave it! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink I also saw Lisa R - doing her John Wayne impression here - and she said someone said she looked czecoslovakian. Hey Lisa, its not true, you don't. I love the scarf! -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink Met Lisa. She's such a cutie-pie and I soooooo wanna marry her. She's been such a mint friend, and she has the stoooopidest dog ever. But I love Purdy too. Cause Purdy's so dim. Anyway, Lisa is mint, always happy, and smiley and... in short, ideal. She finally got herself a boyfriend and is having a wicked time, and she's like, soooooo in love. Jealous! Envy! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Lisa and Lisa put on a live show for me, and it was class too! Phwoarr!! -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink Then we went out to Newcastle and I met up with my good old friend Ginger! She was mint, looked incredibly fabulous, and had many good things to tell me! Her boyfriend DJs and he dropped a tune I wrote on a castle-gig crowd recently, and they were jumping up and down going bonkers and screaming for more! Class! Better get it finished then! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Also saw old overlapping combatant friend, Matt S. And Tweed. We got WRECKED! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink The Tyne bridge in front of the gateshead bridge and the newly completed opera house. Way to go Newcastle! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Eric loves his decks! Anyway, we pumped some tunes out on the turntables and had a few bevvies and rocked the bar-B-Q loads and then went on the lash in Newcastle.... -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Stopped in to say hi to Eric the photographer and his new bird and he was great! He's a grand-dad now, his son just began fathering a baby boy about 8 weeks ago... -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink This guy couldnt fly, (tut tut) so I gave him a helping hand...... -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Almost stepped on this chap! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Anyway, this is what silence looks like.... -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink My aunt, Antonia and I drove to this class place in the middle of nowhere in Sussex. And enjoyed the bliss of silence. I highly recommend it. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Next, I went down to Portsmouth and Havant, and visited my cousin. Right on the South coast of England. And had a wicked time! -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink Nadia even cooked breakfast for me! I felt sooooo special, and thoroughly enjoyed staying in their haven. I even set up Wes's dex for him and spun some tunes. Tons of vinyl. They sure know how to keep a guy happy! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Got to Bristol and visited Nadia and Wes, in their new semi detached country bliss shag-pad cum "everything" home. -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink Anyway, Gibbo was putting waaay too much peer pressure on me, and sooner or later, I was gonna crack under the immense pressure. Suffice to say, I cut my hair - because it only made sense. going back to 35'C and 90% humidity in Japan.... hot hot hot. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink haircut! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Saw some of this. Didnt do anything, mind. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Safe as fuck! Rockin the house party with H and Gibbo. Wicked. -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink After Sheffield, I jumped on the national express (coach) and went to see my great mate, Gibbo in Cardiff - I fucking love that city - and we had a *ahem* nice time at this nice party with some thoroughly nice people, nice tunes, and nice... offerings. ; ) -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink I saw my old friend Rita (I'm in LOVE) in Sheffield, and she's coming to join me in Japan! Did I forget to mention I'm in love? Purrr.... -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink I visited my brother and sister in Sheffield with me mam, and it kicked ass. Center is my sister, April, and right is my brother, Raj. Mint. -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink I visited my way old house I used to live in. I lived in the middle upper window. It was tiny. A cottage in Lytham, but the views and sea air afforded the finest living a man could ever want. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Went to catch up with my Aunt, and all the B.Bees were chilling out for lunch break. Kick ass. I tamed this one 'cause it was all fuzzy. It flew off after a bit. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Mingin colour. A few voracious spiders were inhabiting me mams sink when I got home. Class. -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink When I finally got home, my bag was still in Heathrow somewhere. I got it back 3 days later after the delivery guy delivered it to ANOTHER house. Great. Anyway, the builders were knocking a huge fuck off hole in me mams wall, eg destroying it completely, and they found this pipe. hehehehmhmhmhmhehehehe, huh, yeah, PIPE! (see beavis and butt-head).... turns out this pipe had LOTS of gas in it... and it SHOULDNT have...... so they dug a huge FUCK OFF hole in front of the house to FIX it and switch it off so they could mangle said big gas pipes in Kitchen! *whew* -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink Anyway, these ladies waited on me, and I got a good thing going with a couple of them. One of them, her name was Candy. Nickname anyway. Well, after landing, and the bar with Candy, lets just say first class really was first class. ; ) -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink Crazy. Anyway, I got upgraded to First class on my trip home. It helps to carry a laptop and wear trousers. I said nothing, and was treated to the finest of fine by several Korean ladies called, "Park"... -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink Nature is our most accurate thermostat, and the greens on the local trees are still reading spring colours. 85% humidity, with 32*C temperatures today. And Summer is juuuust about to start... -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink I got bitch-slapped by my razor! not breast pleased! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Deeze are da 'burbs round my place, as viewed from work. The rolling hills at the back of Kobe, before we reach Miki and Kande. Bad framing.... -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink This is what it looks like when the trains get a little backlogged... we're only talking about 5 minutes. This IS Japan. Also incidentally, my 10,002nd digital camera shot in Japan. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Gav the organiser. Also his engagement party =) -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Brett, choking on his tongue since there was not enough beer to water and lubricate it. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Leighton speaks all things Welsh - possibly about the only thing he's qualified to speak on. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink The Hangi is pulled from the ground. Everyone looks on with baited breath. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Food for everyone. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink My dinner. yum. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Feed the 200. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Mmmm. Some like it smothered in Ketchup. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Tons and tons and tons of Lamb. Mmmm. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Yeah, Hello Tony. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Theres only one thing in his eye and on his mind right now... -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Check out those puppies. This one complained of bad hair or something - I forget. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Yoshi tries my battered Oakleys. Yeey! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Happy days. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink The queue - which I didn't experience! -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink Theres a certain serenity at the 'end of the line' places.A transgression to something less accessible. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 15 - Stoke the fridge up with loads of gear! Remember this is a continuous job if you purchased many slabs of beer. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 14 - await arrival of party-goers. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 13 - scatter balloons strategically. A high percentage of surviving balloons is ideal. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 12 - drive 2 blocks back to local party location/shag-pad/gaffe. Wind blowing. Sun blazing. Class. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 11 - eat lots of the swag on way home. Thoroughly stuff face. Make mess. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 10 - Pose, for good measure. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 9 - load the van. Make for the house, pumping tunes out along the way. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 8 - Also purchase Wine. Vodka. Assorted things to make the party go 'bang'. Munchies equipment also. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 7 - go buy some beer. Lots. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 6 - acquire large van. Go shopping in it. -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 5 - blow up tons of balloons with helium, and have whatever fun you normally do with helium, and balloons. In this case, attempt flight, grow boobs. Anything, really. -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 4 - Buy, borrow or steal some extra large noise producing floor-speakers. The larger the better. Speakers are very precious. mmmm. Must keep close at all times. Mmmmm. My precious. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 3 - blaze and surf the 'net, send some emails, then go have a shower, and feel human again. -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 2 - feel awake, alive , and if applicable, a man again. Go stand in the local town center and flex muscle groups for all and sundry to see. -Shot and Posted by Paul

urlLink 10 steps to a successful party: 1 - clear any hang-over from the previous nights partying. Go to nearby official granny-run "ye tea-shoppe" and order a large breakfast for everyone. With Tea. And Orange, or whatever floats your boat. -Shot and Posted by Paul
urlLink It definitely wasn't anything to do with altitude, that's for sure. -Shot and Posted by Paul
